name: Rick
line: (stumbles in drunkenly, and turns on the lights) Morty! You gotta come on. You got--... you gotta come with me.

name: Rick
line: You know what, Morty? You're right. (throws empty bottle into the backseat) Let's forget the girl altogether. She, she's probably nothing but trouble, anyways. (presses a button)

name: Rick
line: (at the same time) Come on! What’s gotten into you? If you love Earth so much why don’t you marry it? (pushes Morty) What are you, crazy? Alright, alright, Morty. (pushes Morty off of him)

name: Jerry
line: I see there's a new episode of that singing show tonight. Who do you guys think is gonna be the best singer? (Morty falls asleep at the table, smashing his face into his plate)

name: Jerry
line: What?

name: Beth
line: Dad?

name: Beth
line: (tears up in happiness) Oh, dad…

name: Mr. Goldenfold
line: Now, look, we're gonna be dealing with some real serious stuff today. You might have heard of it. It's called math? And without it, none of us would even exist, so let's jump right in. Two plus two.

name: Class
line: Awwwwww.

name: Mr. Goldenfold
line: Yeah, you know what?! Aw, too bad! Tough! First row, take one. Pass it back for me. The stakes are high in this room. (Morty stares at the quiz; the numbers on the quiz jumble together as Morty falls asleep) There's crucial things happening here every day. People getting smarter. Some of y'all getting dumber. Some of y'all ain't gonna see 3:00. (Morty falls into a dream world filled with large number-shaped blocks; Jessica steps out from behind some of the numbers)

name: Mr. Goldenfold
line: Morty! What are you doing to me?!

name: Morty
line: (sleep-talking) Ah, Jessica.

name: Mr. Goldenfold
line: Five more minutes of this, and I'm gonna get mad. (leans back and bites his lip)

name: Rick
line: It's pretty obvious, Morty. I froze him. Now listen I need your help, Morty. I mean, we got we got to get get the hell out of here and go take care of business. (burps) It's important. Come on, Morty.

name: Morty
line: I don't know, Rick. I can't leave school again.

name: Rick
line: Do you have any concept of how much higher the stakes get out there, Morty? What do you think I can just do it all by myself? Come on!

name: Morty
line: Aw, geez. Okay. I guess I can skip history. What about Frank? I mean, shouldn't you unfreeze him?

name: Rick
line: I'll do it later, Morty. He'll be fine. Let's go. (takes off with Morty and then Summer comes by, seeing Frank's frozen body)

name: Summer (in her head)
line: Oh, my God. I'm about to walk past Frank Palicky. This is the story we'll be telling our children. (walks up to Frank and talks to him, oblivious to the fact that he's frozen)

name: Summer
line: Hi, Frank. (Frank's frozen foot breaks and he drops to the ground and shatters into a million pieces, dying)

name: Summer
line: AAAAAAAAAAAHHHHH!!!!!!!

name: Beth
line: (performing heart surgery on a horse) Scalpel.

name: Davin
line: Scalpel. (Jerry enters the room)

name: Jerry
line: Knock, knock.

name: Beth
line: Jerry?

name: Jerry
line: My manager gave me an hour for lunch, and I thought, "hey, why not swing by where your wife works?" (The beeping from the medical equipment speeds up)

name: Tom
line: (offscreen) We're losing him. (Beth adjusts the horse's organs)

name: Tom
line: (offscreen) Okay, he's back.

name: Beth
line: Jerry, please tell me you're here for an incredibly urgent reason.

name: Jerry
line: Well, it's lunch. I mean, it's one of three meals that have existed for millennia. (the beeping speeds up again)

name: Tom
line: (offscreen) Losing him. (Beth adjusts the organs again)

name: Tom
line: (offscreen) Stabilized.

name: Beth
line: Okay, I only ask, Jerry, because, as you know, my job involves performing heart surgery.

name: Jerry
line: Well, yeah, on horses.

name: Beth
line: Excuse me?

name: Jerry
line: Okay, Let's not rehash that fight. I sense that you're busy and will now be on my way. (drops a pamphlet on the ground)

name: Jerry
line: Whoa! What is this on the floor? Some kind of literature for a really nice-looking nursing home. Hey, honey, crazy idea bad pitch let's put your dad here. Let's put your dad in a nursing home. (Beth looks at Jerry angrily and the equipment starts beeping faster again)

name: Tom
line: (offscreen) We're losing him.

name: Beth
line: Hey, Tom! We know when we're losing him. WE CAN HEAR THE BEEPS!

name: Rick
line: There she is. All right. Come on, Morty. Let's go.

name: Morty
line: Oh, geez, okay. (Rick and Morty go through the portal and end up in a crazy alternate dimension)

name: Morty
line: Oh, man, Rick. What is this place?

name: Rick
line: It's Dimension 35-C, and it's got the perfect climate conditions for a special type of tree, Morty, called a Mega Tree, and there's fruit in those trees, and there's seeds in those fruits. I'm talking about Mega Seeds. They're they're incredibly powerful, and I need them to help me with my research, Morty.

name: Morty
line: Oh, man, Rick. I'm looking around this place, and I'm starting to work up some anxiety about this whole thing.

name: Rick
line: All right, all right, calm down. Listen to me, Morty. I know that new situations can be intimidating. You're looking around, and it's all scary and different, but, you know, m-meeting them head on, charging right into them like a bull that's how we grow as people. I'm no stranger to scary situations. I deal with them all the time. Now, if you just stick with me, Morty, we're gonna be— (a gigantic alien monster suddenly appears behind them)

name: Rick
line: HOLY CRAP, MORTY RUN!!! (they take off, running in complete and total fear as the monster chases them)

name: Rick
line: I never seen that thing before in my life. I don't even know what the hell it is! We got to get out of here, Morty! It's gonna kill us! We're gonna die! We're gonna die, Morty!

name: Rick
line: (having apparently escaped, they are walking through Dimension 35-C, continuing their adventure) Oh, Morty, take a deep breath. Breathe that breathe that fresh air in, Morty. Y-you smell that? That's the smell of adventure, Morty. That's that's the smell of-of-of-of a whole different evolutionary timeline.

name: Morty
line: All right, Rick, look how much longer is this gonna be? Shouldn't I be back at school by now?

name: Rick
line: Are you joking me? I mean, look at all the crazy crap surrounding us. Look at that thing right there. (a weird looking monster is seen cooing and rolling around on the ground) What the hell is that thing? You think you're gonna see that kind of thing at school? (offscreen) Look at it just lumbering around. (onscreen) It defies all logic, that thing.

name: Morty
line: Yeah, Rick, I get it. We're surrounded by monsters. That's kind of the reason why I want to leave. (they come up to a cliff and Rick stops him there)

name: Rick
line: Ta-ta-ta-ta-ta-ta. Morty, you see this? (he and Morty are looking down upon a vast forest of interdimensional trees)

name: Rick
line: You see what we just stumbled upon, Morty? Any idea what that is down there?

name: Morty
line: The mega trees?

name: Rick
line: That's right, Morty the mega trees with the mega fruit on them and that's what I'm talking about, Morty. That's where my seeds are. If we would have done what you wanted, I would have never have found them, because you're so in love with school.

name: Morty
line: All right, all right. So, what's so special about these seeds, anyways?

name: Rick
line: You ask a lot of questions, Morty. Not very charismatic. It makes you kind of an (burps) under- (burps) underfoot figure. (Rick gives Morty a pair of shoes and Morty proceeds to put them on)

name: Rick
line: Just take these shoes, Morty. They're (burps) special grappling shoes. When you're wearing these things, these babies, you can basically just walk on any surface you want, Morty up, down, below, turn around to the left. These things really bring it all together.

name: Morty
line: (walks off the cliff and plummets to the ground, screaming and smashing into rocks) AAAAAAAHHHH!!!!!!

name: Rick
line: You have to turn them on, Morty! The shoes have to be turned on!

name: Beth
line: I am not putting my father in a home! He just came back into my life, and you want to grab him and stuff him under a mattress like last month's Victoria's Secret?

name: Jerry
line: I told you I was ordering you something for Valentine's Day. More importantly, your father is a horrible influence on our son.

name: Davin
line: Everything cool in here, Beth?

name: Beth
line: It's fine, Davin.

name: Davin
line: Okay, cool. You know, we did something great today. There's nothing more noble and free than the heart of a horse. (Jerry closes the door on Davin)

name: Jerry
line: Since we're fighting, if you ever have an affair with that guy, I will come to the hotel room and blow my brains out all over your naked bodies.

name: Beth
line: Look, I appreciate the stress you're under, but Morty was having trouble in school way before my dad moved in, and the only influence I can see Rick having is that, for the first time in his life, Morty has a friend. (the phone starts ringing)

name: Jerry
line: (sighs) Well, maybe you're right.

name: Beth
line: Uh, yeah, maybe I am. I'm my father's daughter. I'm smart. Why do you think I'm a heart surgeon?

name: Jerry
line: (coughs) Ahem, Horse heart surgeon. (Beth answers the phone and gets a call from Morty's principal, Gene Vagina)

name: Principal Vagina
line: Hello? Mrs. Smith? This is Principal Vagina, no relation. I wonder if you and Morty's father might be able to have a chat with me this afternoon?

name: Rick
line: (standing by Morty, who is lying on the ground with his legs broken) Morty, oh, you really d-did a number on (offscreen) your legs right now. You know, you got to turn (onscreen) the shoes on, Morty, for them to work. Yeah, look I turned mine on. I had no problem getting down here. It was a leisurely breeze.

name: Morty
line: I'm in a lot of pain, Rick!

name: Rick
line: Yeah, I can see that. But do you think you'll still be able to help me (burps) collect my seeds, Morty?

name: Morty
line: Are you kidding me?! That's it, Rick! That's the last straw! I can't believe this! I'm sitting here with both of my legs broken, and you're still asking me about getting those seeds?! Ooh! Ow! Oh! Y-y-you're a monster. Y-you're like Hitler, but-but even Hitler cared about Germany or something.

name: Rick
line: Okay, hold on just a second, Morty. (opens another portal and leaves Morty behind, lying on the ground to suffer for a few seconds)

name: Morty
line: Ooh! Ohh! Ooh! Hnngh! Hoo! Ooh! Ohh! Aaaaagh! Oooooh! (Rick finally returns and injects Morty's legs with medicine, healing them to perfection)

name: Morty
line: Ooh, Ohh, Ooh. Wow, Rick. That stuff just healed my broken legs instantly. I mean, I've never felt so good in my life. Thank you.

name: Rick
line: Don't worry about it, Morty. Just come help me get these seeds, all right, buddy?

name: Morty
line: Sure thing, Rick. (goes up the tree and gets the Mega Fruit while Rick talks to him)

name: Rick
line: Not that you asked, Morty, but what just happened there is I went into a future dimension with such advanced medicine that they had broken-leg serum at every corner drugstore. (offscreen) The stuff was all over the place, Morty.

name: Morty
line: Wow, that's pretty crazy, Rick.

name: Rick
line: There's just one problem, Morty one little hang-up. The dimension I visited was so advanced, that (burps) they had also halted the aging process, and everyone there was young, Morty, and they had been forever. I was the only old person there, Morty. (burps) It was like I was some sort of, you know, celebrity, walking around. I-I was fascinating to them. There were a lot of attractive women there, Morty, and they-they-they— they all wanted time with me. I had a lot of fun with a lot of young ladies, but I spent so much time there, my interdimensional portal device it's got no charge left, Morty. It's got no charge left.

name: Morty
line: What?!

name: Rick
line: It's as good as garbage, Morty. It's not gonna work anymore, Morty.

name: Morty
line: Oh, geez, Rick, that's not good. W-what are we gonna do? I-I have to be back at school right now. How are we gonna get back home?

name: Rick
line: There's ways to get back home, Morty. It's just it's just gonna be a little bit of a hassle. We're gonna have to go through interdimensional customs, so you're gonna have to do me a real solid.

name: Morty
line: Uh-oh.

name: Rick
line: When we get to customs, I'm gonna need you to take these seeds into the bathroom, and I'm gonna need you to put them way up inside your butthole, Morty.

name: Morty
line: In my butt?

name: Rick
line: Put them way up inside there, as far as they can fit.

name: Morty
line: Oh, geez, Rick. I really don't want to have to do that.

name: Rick
line: Well, somebody's got to do it, Morty. Th-these seeds aren't gonna get through customs unless they're in someone's rectum, Morty

name: Morty
line: Uuuh.

name: Rick
line: And they'll fall right out of mine. I've done this too many times, Morty. I mean, you're young. Y-y-you've got your whole life ahead of you, and your anal cavity is still taut, yet malleable. You got to do it for grandpa, Morty. Y- (burps) you've got to put these seeds inside your butt.

name: Morty
line: In my butt?

name: Rick
line: Come on, Morty. Please, Morty. You have to do it, Morty.

name: Morty
line: Oh, man.

name: Principal Vagina
line: The fact is, your son, Morty, has attended this school for a total of seven hours over the last two months.

name: Beth
line: What? Why didn't you notify us?

name: Principal Vagina
line: I done been notifying you. Have you not been getting the messages I've been leaving with Morty's grandfather?

name: Jerry
line: Boom! Told you! In your face! He is ruining our child! Wait, what am I celebrating?

name: Principal Vagina
line: Yeah, see, I thought something was fishy there, because it's usually Morty's grandpa that's taking him out of school. (they stop to see Summer and some other students, crying at an obituary for Frank)

name: Beth
line: Summer?

name: Summer
line: (sobs) What kind of God lets this happen?

name: Principal Vagina
line: We had a little incident. A student was frozen to death. (chuckles) And there's no evidence that a Latino student did it! Everyone wants to take this to a racial place. I won't let them.

name: Announcer
line: The glarp zone is for flarping and unglarping only.

name: Alien
line: So, I told him, "give me the blimfarx," you know? This-this guy he doesn't understand interstellar currency.

name: Alien
line: It's, like, I'm trying to eat a flimflam like, that's what we eat on Girvonesk.

name: Announcer
line: The glarp zone is for flarping and unglarping only.

name: Rick
line: (Morty comes up to him, who is waiting in line to get through security) I don't like it here, Morty. I can't abide bureaucracy. I don't like being told where to go and what to do. I consider it a violation. Did you get those seeds all the way up your butt?

name: Morty
line: Yeah, Rick. Let's just get this over with, okay? I mean, these things are pointy. They hurt.

name: Rick
line: That means they're good ones. You're a good kid, Morty. Those mega seeds are super valuable to my work. You've been a huge help to me. I'm gonna be able to do a-

name: Gromflomite
line: Okay, next through. (stops Morty) Except you. You go over there.

name: Rick
line: Why does he have to go over there?

name: Gromflomite
line: Random check. He's got to go through the new machine.

name: Rick
line: What new- (burps) what new machine?

name: Gromflomite
line: It's a new machine. It detects stuff all the way up your butt.

name: Rick
line: Run, Morty! Run! (grabs Morty and they run through security and dart for the exit)

name: Morty
line: Aaaaaah!

name: Gromfomite
line: Red alert! (team of Gromflomites starts chasing after Rick and Morty)

name: Morty
line: Ohhhhh! (Rick pushes over a giant capsule, with an alien fetus over, smashing some Gromflomites, to slow them down)

name: Morty
line: Ohhhhhh! (an alien is seen smoking a hookah and Morty runs past him and accidentally inhales the smoke from the hookah while Rick comes from behind and slaps the alien in the face, causing the alien to cry; he then coughs up a life form from the smoke and the lifeform starts running through the glarp zone and goes through the entire aging process from developing fetus to decomposing corpse, over the course of three seconds)

name: Morty
line: Aaaaah!

name: Rick
line: Don't think about it! (he and Morty are cornered but Morty activates the grappling shoes and runs up the wall with Rick)

name: Rick
line: Ooh! Oh, nice, Morty! The student becomes the teacher. (the Gromflomites reveal that they can fly and then Rick and Morty start running away)

name: Morty
line: Whoooooo! (he and Rick run through the equipment on the ceiling, before they slip off to the ground)

name: Alien
line: Aah! Aw, hell, no, dawg. You know me I'm just trying to— (Rick and Morty crash to the ground and he dies; they then run to the portal computer)

name: Rick
line: I need to type in the coordinates to our home world, Morty. Cover me. (he tosses Morty a gun)

name: Morty
line: Oh, man. I mean, you know, I-I don't want to shoot nobody.

name: Rick
line: They're just robots, Morty! It's okay to shoot them! They're robots! (Morty shoots a Glenn, blowing his leg off, and making blood gush out as he drops down in pain)

name: Glenn
line: Aaaaah! My leg is shot off!

name: Other Gromflomite
line: Glenn's bleeding to death! Someone call his wife and children!

name: Morty
line: They're not robots, Rick!

name: Rick
line: It's a figure of speech, Morty. They're bureaucrats. I don't respect them. Just keep shooting, Morty. You have no idea what prison is like here! (Morty continues shooting the Gromflomites and even kills some innocent bystanders while Rick hacks into the portal to take them back home)

name: Morty
line: Holy crap! This is insane! (Rick opens the portal and takes Morty in with him)

name: Rick
line: Come on, Morty! We got to get the hell out of here! (the portal opens up in the lunchroom at school and Rick and Morty land on the table where Jessica and her friends are eating)

name: Jessica
line: Wow. Did you just come into the cafeteria through a portal?

name: Morty
line: Uh, yeah. Well, you know, my-my Ferrari's in the shop. (nervously laughs) Just kidding.

name: Jessica
line: You're Morty, right?

name: Morty
line: Yeah. (Rick grabs Morty and takes him way)

name: Rick
line: You can get his number later. Come on, Morty. We got to get out of here. You got to get those seeds out of your ass. (Rick and Morty are stopped by Jerry, Beth, and Principal Vagina)

name: Jerry
line: Oh, look, honey. It's our son with Albert Ein-douche.

name: Beth
line: What?

name: Jerry
line: I'm an angry father, not an improviser.

name: Rick
line: Oh, hi, Jerry. Oh, my goodness, Morty! What are you doing out of class? We talked about this. Your-your parents and I are very disappointed in-in this behavior... No? No takers? (Rick and Morty are back at home in the garage while Jerry and Beth start taking all his things and packing them up so he can move to the nursing home)

name: Rick
line: You guys should really not be touching that stuff. It's beyond your reasoning.

name: Jerry
line: You're beyond our reasoning!

name: Rick
line: Takes one to know one.

name: Beth
line: Dad, how could you make my son miss an entire semester of school? I mean, it's not like he's a hot girl. He can't just bail on his life and set up shop in someone else's.

name: Rick
line: What what are you guys doing with my stuff?

name: Beth
line: We're moving you to a nursing home.

name: Rick
line: A nursing home? What are what are you, nuts? I'm a genius. I build robots for fun.

name: Jerry
line: Well, now you can build baskets and watch Paul Newman movies on VHS and mentally scar the Boy Scouts every Christmas.

name: Beth
line: What does that mean?

name: Jerry
line: It's personal.

name: Morty
line: Dad, mom, come on. Rick just needed my help is all.

name: Jerry
line: Morty, stay out of this. You are obviously not capable of judging these situations on your own.

name: Rick
line: What are you trying to say about Morty? That he's stupid or something?

name: Beth
line: Oh, don't high-road us, dad. You know fully well that Morty is the last child that needs to be missing classes.

name: Rick
line: I-I-I don't know what you mean by that. Can can can you be a little bit more specific?

name: Jerry
line: Oh, for crying out—he's got some kind of disability or something. Is that what you want us to say?

name: Morty
line: I do?

name: Jerry
line: Well, duh doy, son. Look, I love you, Morty, but we both know you're not as fast as the other kids, and if you want to compete in this world, you got to work twice as hard.

name: Morty
line: Aw, geez, dad. Y-you know, that's a lot to drop on a kid all at once.

name: Rick
line: Morty, t-tell your parents the square root of pi.

name: Morty
line: Oh, come on, Rick. You know I can't.

name: Rick
line: The square root of Pi, Morty. Go!

name: Beth
line: What the hell?

name: Jerry
line: (checks Morty's answer with calculator) Holy crap. He's right.

name: Rick
line: Morty, tell your parents the first law of Thermodynamics.

name: Morty
line: "The increment in the internal energy of a system is equal to the increment of heat supplied to the system." Wow! I'm so smart!

name: Jerry
line: But—

name: Rick
line: I told the both of you school is stupid. It's not how you learn things. Morty's a gifted child. He has a special mind. That's why he's my little helper. He's like me. He's gonna be doing great science stuff later in his life. He's too smart for school. He needs to keep hanging out and helping me.

name: Beth
line: Jerry, I don't want whatever's happening here to stop.

name: Jerry
line: No, I-I understand. Uh, maybe we overreacted. But he has to keep going to school.

name: Rick
line: Okay, Jerry. You drive a hard bargain, but what am I supposed to do? Say no? You-you really wear the pants around here. I just want you to know, between us, from now on, it's gonna be clear communication. (Summer butts in, crying over the death of Frank)

name: Summer
line: (crying) Frank Palicky was frozen to death today!

name: Rick
line: No idea what you're talking about. (Summer leaves, crying)

name: Jerry
line: Okay. Well, uh, Morty, it's your bedtime in an hour. Don't stay up all night again. This is good, though. This can work. I think we can be a family and now, Beth, if you'll have me, I would love to have you.

name: Beth
line: You know what? Okay. (she and Jerry leave)

name: Morty
line: Holy cow, Rick. I didn't know hanging out with you was making me smarter.

name: Rick
line: Full disclosure, Morty it's not. Temporary superintelligence is just a side effect of the mega seeds dissolving in your rectal cavity.

name: Morty
line: Aw, man.

name: Rick
line: Yeah, and once those seeds wear off, you're gonna lose most of your motor skills, and you're also gonna lose a significant amount of brain functionality for 72 hours, Morty.

name: Morty
line: Ohh, man. (losing consciousness) Oh, geez! Ohh. (drops to the ground and starts moaning as he has a seizure)

name: Rick
line: I'm sorry, Morty. It's a bummer. In reality, you're as dumb as they come and I needed those seeds real bad, and I had to give them up just to get your parents off my back, so now we're gonna have to go get more adventures. (excitedly looks down upon him, telling him about their future adventures) And then we're gonna go on even more adventures after that, Morty and you're gonna keep your mouth shut about it, Morty, because the world is full of idiots that don't understand what's important, and they'll tear us apart, Morty but if you stick with me, I'm gonna accomplish great things, Morty, and you're gonna be part of them, and together, we're gonna run around, Morty. We're gonna do all kinds of wonderful things, Morty. Just you and me, Morty. The outside world is our enemy, Morty. We're the only friends we've got, Morty. It's just Rick and Morty. Rick and Morty and their adventures, Morty. Rick and Morty forever and forever. Morty's things. Me and Rick and Morty running around, and Rick and Morty time. All day long, forever. All a hundred days. Rick and Morty forever 100 times. Over and over, rickandmortyadventures.com. All 100 years. Every minute, rickandmorty.com.
